poem:
Title: "Footprints of Speed"

Seven times over, into the fury of haste,
Unseen vapors warbling in the Twickenham morn.
A hybrid in blues, threading London's lace,
Tangled in the Judge's twenty-first-century scorn.

Oh Zac, erstwhile keeper of Earth's choir,
In the dance of miles and minutes contrived,
Each breach narrates a tale of ire,
In the silent prison of speed, freedom derived.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Zac Goldsmith banned from driving after breaking speed limit seven times Zac Goldsmith was warned by a judge that speeding drivers “emit more harmful emissions” as he was banned from driving for a year for a number of motoring offences. The former environment minister, 49, broke speed limits seven times in his hybrid Volkswagen Golf on London roads in Paddington, Chelsea and Twickenham between April and November 2023. He was also caught speeding on two". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
